  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PROX 43980 was found in the Yardley yard in Spokane, WA to have a small leak coming from the top of the car. Upon investigation, it was found to have a defective manway gasket. The gasket was cut due to overtightening of the swing bolts. The gasket was replaced, swing bolts were tool-tightened and the car was cleaned.

item.title: Report X-2023041215
item.description:
Report X-2023041215

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-30T18:11:29+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-04-12
  • City: UNION GAP
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was brought over to QA in a damaged Hazmat bin with a can liner. The lid was pressed on the bin because of the strong scent of hydrogen peroxide. The box was wet and was going to need an inspection. The liquid was clear but when it dried it left the box a pale yellow. DescribePack: The cap of the container had a small little hole for ventilation to prevent over pressurization. The box was turned upside down which allowed the small hole to leak slowly. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: It was placed in a bin with a can liner and closed with the lid. The package was not pouring liquids. It only leaked enough to wet the box.

  • Description: DURING NORMAL PACKAGE HANDLING WE DISCOVERED A PACKAGE THAT WAS COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY 2.5 KGS OF DRY ICE COOLING FOOD. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX INDICATING DRY ICE WAS BEING SHIPPED.

DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: IMMEDIATELY TRANSFERED TO RED LINED TOTE, SEALED OFF TO MITIGATE FUMES.

  • Description: CBTX 716358 was identified as releasing from manway at BNSF Vancouver, WA Terminal. Contractors identified a gasket that was deteriorated and crushed, possibly due to excessive torque on man way swing bolts due to the amount of force required to inspect man way gasket. Man way gasket was replaced with nozzle gasket and car secured after exterior decontamination.

item.title: Report I-2023050014
item.description:
Report I-2023050014

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-30T18:11:29+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-30
  • City: Tacoma
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Water
  • Carrier/Reporter: TOTE MARITIME ALASKA, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On March 30; 2023, TAG inspected LTIA 329610, booking SEA 912229. This load sailed southbound on the Midnight Sun, voyage 23046 that departed Anchorage, AK on March 26th, 2023. Upon inspection, TAG found one box marked"Rustoleum Clear Garage Coating" labeled as limited quantity. According to the SDS, this material is hazardous and is classified as UN3066, class 8, PGII, paint or paint related material, corrosive liquid. This item was not included on the bill of lading when submitted to Anchorage and the trailer sailed with undeclared hazardous material. For the safety of our vessel crew and longshore, it is imperative hazardous loads are properly manifested.

  • Description: XPO terminal USE notified ERTS of a 1 cup release of UN1814 "Nalco BC1604" from a 15-gallon poly drum due to improper loading by the previous terminal, impacting the side of the drum and pallet. ERTS dispatched a contractor for cleanup and containment. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-cup of product released to the side of the 15-gallon poly drum due to a damaged cap. A second 5-gallon poly drum of product was also damaged. The 15-gallon drum and 5-gallon pail were each placed into a 55-gallon and 30-gallon poly drums. All absorbent pads and PPE were containerized into a 15-gallon poly drum. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal USK experienced a release from (4) 1-pint poly jugs of UN1760 "SparClean All Temp Detergent" & (8) 1-gallon poly jugs of non-regulated "Clean on the Go". ERTS dispatched contractors to assist with cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 10-ounces of each product released to their packaging only due to the containers being crushed. The damaged jugs and impacted absorbents for Clean on the Go were placed into a 15-gallon and 30-gallon poly drums. The damaged jugs and impacted absorbents for SparClean were placed into separate 15-gallon and 30-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was brought to repacks because the package had a wet side/corner. When it was realized it was a Hazmat it was placed in a plastic bag and sealed with a zip tie. it was then placed in the hazmat cage. DescribePack: In the beginning I unable to ascertain a visible reason for the damage, but after placing the bottles on a plastic bag, I found liquid where there shouldn't have been. So, I then started to gently press on the edges of the bottle and found two bottles with small cracks at the bottom of the bottle. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package is too big to go in a regular tote. So it was placed in a bag and sealed with a zip tie. before placing in the hazmat cage.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found on pallet to be leaking powder when being prepared for trailer load. It was then brought to QA to be placed in a well ventilated area to await further processing. DescribePack: Upon further inspection it was discovered to have been caused by both lids on the internal containers not being tightly secured, allowing for product to spill. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a hazmat bin & brought to a well ventilated area. All powder was contained & any that got onto the floor was wiped with absorbent pads.

DescribePack: All 4 caps came loose during shipment and there are 4 distinct corroded marks on the cardboard. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed the package in a red hazmat tote and secured the caps on the bottle.

  • Description: XPO terminal USE reported a release of an unknown amount of "Sulfuric Acid" (UN1830) from a 375-gallon poly tote due to improper loading inside of the trailer. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct containment and cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 15-gallons of product released to an 8' x 5' area of the trailer floor and a 20' x 6' area of the dock floor due to improper loading. The material was transferred into a new tote. Absorbents were deployed and baking soda was utilized to neutralize the impacted areas. The damaged tote was cut up and containerized into two supersacks. All impacted absorbents and cleanup debris were collected into two 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to

Upon examining the package they did not find any markings or indications that they package contained dangerous goods, except a packing list that showed the package contained aerosol cans. item.description:
Report E-2022120385

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-29T21:08:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-12-08
  • City: MOUNT VERNON
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On December 8, 2022, at 1051 ET, XPO Logistics (UMV terminal) contacted ERTS regarding a UN3265, Corrosive, Liquid, Acidic, Organic, N.O.S., 8, PG II "Spectrus NX1100" release that occurred at 1015 ET. It was advised that up to 3 ounces of product released to the dock from a 5-gallon plastic pail due to puncture by a pallet nail. It was advised that the release was cleaned prior to ERTS being contacted and that the container and cleanup debris were placed into a steel drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to correctly containerize the release. Contractors arrived onsite and advised terminal personnel had placed the waste into a metal drum. Crew collected the damaged jug and all cleanup debris from the metal drum and properly containerized the material into a 35-gallon poly drum. The metal drum was decontaminated for future use. All waste was left onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: On 10/10/202, BNSF SSeattle IMF notified LARS of destination unit JBHU 239342 (billed HAZ, UN 1263, Flammable Paint) which was observed to be leaking a liquid during the de ramping process. Upon inspection US Ecology observed a standard shipment with multiple differentiating pieces of cargo unsecured on pallets and no void fillers. During transit the pallets were able to shift and puncture 3 6.5 gallon cans that caused the total leakage of 10.5 gallons of paint related material, confirmed to be hazardous, UN 1263. USE completed the remediation by securing the remaining buckets and re palletized, and all three damaged buckets were secured in containers to prevent any additional leakage.

item.title: Report I-2022120147
item.description:
Report I-2022120147

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-29T21:08:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-09-22
  • City: RICHLAND
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release

  • Carrier/Reporter: Clean Earth Specialty Waste Solution
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: An undeclared hazardous material was discovered following a completed waste shipment. The undeclared material was 18.3 grams of U-238 (depleted uranium). A Hazardous Waste Shipment left the Framatome site on August 5, 2022 for Clean Earth Specialty Waste Solutions in Tacoma Washington. On September 22, 2022 at about 11 :30, a Framatome Waste Engineer informed Framatome EHS&L (Environmental Health Safety and Licensing) management that this shipment included waste that had not passed the free release criteria for radioactive waste. The shipment included seven containers that went to Clean Earth Specialty Waste Solutions in Tacoma, Washington on the August 5th, 2022 shipment. To date, five of the seven waste containers have been returned to Framatome and have been confirmed that no radioactive material was present. The first of the two remaining waste packages is listed in sections 14, 26 and 27 above. The second package included material not regulated by DOT, (WA state dangerous waste only, Toxic). Both packages were of the same UN specification markings.

  • Description: At 1748 ET, XPO terminal UPW contacted ERTS to report a spill that occurred on the dock in Pasco, WA. The spill consisted of an unknown number of 1 gallon plastic jugs containing ZEP Big Z, which arrived already damaged in a carton containing four of the items, which was taken out of the trailer and was on the dock. ERTS dispatch GrayMar to conduct cleanup operations. At 1910 ET, contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 3 ounces of product released from a box containing (4) 1 gallon jugs. Absorbents were worked into the impacted areas and collected. The damaged box, jugs, and all cleanup debris was collected and containerized into a 55 gallon poly drum which was left onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: RESPONDER RECIEVED A CALL ABOUT A LEAKING HAZMAT ON THE BOXLINE. UPON ARRIVAL RESPONDER SAW A BOX WITH A POOL OF LIQUID AT ONE OF ITS CORNERS. UPON INSPECTION SAW THE CLASS 8 DIAMOND HAZARD LABEL AND SHIPPING PAPERS. CONSULTING THE RESPONSE SHEET DONNED PROPER PPE AND MOVED THE BOX INTO A SPILL TUB. THEN USED LITMUS PAPER AND DETERMINED THE LIQUID TO BE A BASE. RESPONDER ADDED SODIUM BICARBONATE UNTIL THE LIQUID WAS NEUTRAL THEN SOLIDIFIED AND SWEPT IT UP, ADDING IT INTO THE SPILL TUB. THEN TOOK THE PACKGE BACK TO THE DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

Spill was cleaned as well as possible and package was placed in a steel salvage drum pending FAA investigation and package.

The driver used an overpack container and overpacked the leaking package. He then used absorbent towels to soak up the remaining leaked material.

  • Description: JBHU 286750 that contained hazmat that was observed leaking a clear paint like liquid onto the ground in its parking spot, seeping through the floor. Contractor US Ecology was contacted and responded with a crew to inspect and remediate. Upon arrival, USE inspected the cargo in the container and found a pallet of 5 gal pails of "Milesi" clear lacquer paint where several pails had been creased, likely occurring during loading from the next pallet of product being pushed into it. Approximately 10 15 gallons of product total had leaked out of several creased pails

  • Description: The tank had returned to the yard with approximately 400 gallons of Waste Corrosive Liquid, Acidic, Inorganic n.o.s. (Sulfuric Acid) 8, PG II on Friday 8/19/2022. On 8/20/2022 it was discovered that material had leaked onto the pavement. The material was cleaned up immediately and inspection of the valve revealed that the valve may not have properly seated and there was not a gasket in the cap to prevent liquid from leaking. Vacuum was applied to the tank and the valve was opened and closed a few times to ensure the valve closed properly. These actions worked and there was no additional release of the material. The material was transferred into totes and transported for disposal.

  • Description: On August 11, 2022, Estes contacted ERTS requesting to dispatch a remediation contractor to address a reported spill of UN3320 that was caused following a hard braking incident. Following contractor arrival and assessment of the involved cargo, it was determined that a single tote was damaged / crushed when the aforementioned braking incident caused the preceding cargo to crush the leaking tote. This leak came from a cut/slice in the tote likely from impact with an adjacent piece of cargo / tote. Media affected included trailer flooring and underlying asphalt, which were both addressed properly with associated waste currently pending disposal.

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 8, 2022, at 2145 ET, XPO Logistics experienced a UN1791 WSI Bleach 12.5% release from a 330 gallon poly tote due to a puncture. No soils, drains, or waterways were reported to have been impacted by the release. ERTS dispatched GrayMar Environmental Services to conduct all onsite cleanup operations. On August 9, 2022, at 0019 ET, GrayMar personnel arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 60 gallons of product released to a 50 x 8 area of the trailer floor and asphalt lot. The remaining product in the damaged tote was transferred out and into a new one. Absorbents were then worked into the impacted areas and collected. The damaged tote was cut up and containerized along with all cleanup debris into (3) 55 gallon metal drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While conducting post-trip inspection, the driver noticed drops of dried dark material on the skirts of the trailer carrying hazardous waste. The material was no longer dripping at the time of discovery and the driver concluded that immediate action was not required. The driver contacted emergency response for trailer investigation and clean up. Emergency response arrived and entered the trailer. A long stain was discovered along the floor of the trailer. The stain appeared to have been released from a 55-gallon drum with stains around the bung, but no evidence of an active leak was discovered. The suspected drum was placed in a salvage drum and the stain on the trailer floor was cleaned to the best of their ability. Upon inspection and investigation, it was determined that the likely root cause of this release was due to not properly checking the closure of the bung.

item.title: Report I-2022070814
item.description:
Report I-2022070814

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-29T21:08:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-06-04
  • City: Kent
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: ON JUNE 4TH STATION MANAGEMENT IN KENT WASHINGTON WAS ALERTED TO A UNDECLARED DG SHIPMENT THAT WENT THROUGH OUR SYSTEM AND MADE IT TO THE LOCAL STATION. A MANAGER AND 2 OTHER EMPLOYEES WENT OUT TO FIND THE PACKAGE IN THE WEARHOUSE. AFTER LOCATING PACKAGE THEY CONTACTED DG ADMIN TO INFORM THEM THAT OF THE FOUND PACKAGE. THEY WERE INFORMED TO OPEN THE PACKAGE AND DOCUMENT ALL SIX SIDES WITH PICTURES OF THE OUTER PACKAGE WHICH WAS A SMALL FEDEX BOX FOR DG STICKERS WHICH THEY FOUND NONE ATTACHED. THEY THEN PROCEEDED TO OPEN THE PACKAGE WHERE THEY FOUND AN EMPTY .22 WMR AMMO PACKAGING THAT WAS USED AS PACKING MATERIAL THAT WAS HOLDING A WHITE FEDEX PAK THERE WERE NO DG STICKERS AFFIXED TO THE FEDEX PAK AT ALL. THEY OPENED THE FEDEX PAK AND IT CONTAINED 10 BOXES OF .22 WMR AMMO, 50 CARTRIDGES PER BOX. THERE WAS NO OTHER PACKING MATERIAL INSIDE THE FEDEX PAK OTHER THAN THE 10 BOXES OF AMMO. ALL STEPS WERE DOCUMENTD THOUGH PHOTOS AND SENT TO DANGEROUS GOODS ADMINISTRATION. PACKAGE IS BEING HELD FOR FURTHER INSTRUCTION.

item.title: Report I-2022090061
item.description:
Report I-2022090061

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-29T21:08:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-06-16
  • City: Spokane
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: THIS PACKAGE OF UNDECLARED DG WAS DISCOVERED ON 6/16/22 WHEN IT WAS REPORTED TO ME AT DG ADMINISTRATION/CORPORATE SAFETY. THE PACKAGE WAS LOCATED IN A CAGE IN THE BUILDING. THE OUTER PACKAGE A FIBERBOARD BOX WAS DAMAGED AND A LABEL INSIDE THE PACKAGE ON ONE OF THE THREE PLASTIC INNER BOXES HAD SOME VERBIAGE ABOUT AMMUNITION. UPON INSPECTION OF ONE OF THE BOXES AFTER OPENING IT THE BOX DID CONTAIN AMMUNITION. AS THE SHIPPER HAD NOT OFFERED THE SHIPMENT WITH ANY DG MARKS, DG LABELS NOR A SHIPPERS DECLARATION IT IS UNDECLARED/HIDDEN DG. THE FAA WAS NOTIFIED VIA EMAIL AND PHOTOS SENT. THE SHIPMENT WAS HELD PENDING FAA INVESTIGATION UNTIL THEY RELEASED IT FOR PICKUP.

item.title: Report I-2022070514
item.description:
Report I-2022070514

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-29T21:08:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-06-09
  • City: Kent
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: INGENIUM GROUP, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While offloading waste drums from a storage trailer on the morning of 06/09/2022, the yard technician noticed that some waste material had been released from a drum. Ingenium's incident investigation team determined that the likely cause of the release was due to a failure to fully secure the waste containefs lid at the time of pick-up. The spilled material was confined to Ingenium's storage and did not otherwise make contact with the environment. The spilled material was removed from the dock and the Ieaking container was overpacked into a salvage drum. Upon inspection and investigation, it was determined that the likely root cause of this release was due to a training deficiency for the technician.

  • Description: On June 16, 2022, Landstar notified ERTS of a release of UN1824 "Liquid Dishmachine Detergent spill that occurred from two (2) 5-gallon plastic pails. Following contractor arrival, it was confirmed one quart spilled due to a bad seal on the pail. The two containers of concern were containerized into a single 55-gallon DF along with affected cardboard, cut up pallet, and absorbents used to address affected trailer flooring components. All waste was staged at the contractors facility for profile and proper disposal.

  • Description: AT 01:40 A PT SUPERVISOR CALLED FOR A ACTIVE HAZMAT LEAKER, I RESPOND TO THE CALL. IMMEDIATELY GRAB MY PPE AND DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEETS, AND WENT TO THE LOCATION OF THE SPILLAGE. WHEN I ARRIVED FOLLOW MY DECISION TREE AND PROCEED TO FIND THE RESPONSE SHEET FOR FLAMMABLE LIQUID. I FOLLOW THE COMMANDS AND INSTRUCTIONS TO DO A IN-HOUSE CLEAN UP AND TRANSPORT TO DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.
